title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn from a newly published study about cats?

Options.text: They can be trained to understand the physical world.
They know what kind of prey might be easier to hunt.
They have a natural ability to locate animals they hunt.
They are capable of telling which way their prey flees.

questionsOne.Statement: What may account for the catsâ€™ response to the noise from the containers?

Options.text: Their inborn sensitivity to noise.
Their unusual sense of direction.
Their special ability to perceive.
Their mastery of cause and effect.

questionsOne.Statement: What is characteristic of the way cats hunt, according to the Japanese researchers?

Options.text: They depend on their instincts.
They rely mainly on their hearing.
They wait some time before attack.
They use both their ears and eyes.

questionsOne.Statement: In what way do babies behave like cats?

Options.text: They focus on what appears odd.
They view the world as normal.
They do what they prefer to do.
They are curious about everything.

questionsOne.Statement: What can we conclude about cats from the passage?

Options.text: They have higher intelligence than many other animals.
They interact with the physical world much like humans.
They display extraordinarily high intelligence in hunting.
They can aid physics professors in their research work.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What would be the impact of the extensive use of driverless cars?

Options.text: People would be driving in a more civilized way.
It would save local governments a lot of money.
More policemen would be patrolling the streets.
Traffic regulations would be a thing of the past.

questionsTwo.Statement: How would the elderly and the disabled benefit from driverless cars?

Options.text: They could enjoy greater mobility.
They would suffer no road accidents.
They would have no trouble driving.
They could go anywhere they want.

questionsTwo.Statement: What would be the negative impact of driverless cars?

Options.text: The conflict between labor and management would intensify.
The gap between various sectors of society would be widened.
Professional drivers would have a hard time adapting to new road conditions.
Numerous professional drivers would have to find new ways of earning a living.

questionsTwo.Statement: What is the result of the introduction of new technologies in energy industries?

Options.text: Political dissatisfaction.
Retraining of employees.
Fossil fuel conservation.
Business restructuring.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author suggest businesses and the government do?

Options.text: Keep pace with technological developments.
Make new technologies affordable to everyone.
Enable everyone to benefit from new technologies.
Popularize the use of new technologies and devices.
